}} 'Cardiff City Football Club' () is a professional football club based in
Cardiff, Wales but competing in the English football league system. The club
will compete in the Premier League for the first time in the 2013â14 season.
They play their home games at the Cardiff City Stadium, after moving from Ninian
Park in 2009.

The club was founded as Riverside A.F.C. in 1899 and is the only club from
outside England to have won the FA Cup, which they won in 1927. The club won the
Football League Championship title in the 2013 season and were promoted to the
top flight for the first time in 51 years.

In 2012, Cardiff City was rebranded by the club's Malaysian owner, Vincent Tan.
This included the change of the club's home colours and crest.
categories: Welsh football clubs in English leagues
